intro: Aethionema elongatum, commonly known as the elongated rockcress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in spring. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Aethionema elongatum is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand saline and arid conditions.
